com.diogonunes.jcdp.color

Class ColoredPrinter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.diogonunes.jcdp.color.ColoredPrinter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPrinter, IColoredPrinter, AutoCloseable

    public class ColoredPrinter
extends Object
implements IColoredPrinter, AutoCloseable
    If you want to create a Colored Printer this is the only class you should use. This is your Colored Printers Factory and it abstracts the creation of a Colored Printer and its real implementation. It offers two types of constructors, one for static and other for dynamic printers. If you use the static constructor you will use one implementation offered by the library. If you use the dynamic constructor you must pass as argument an instance of any class that implements IColoredPrinter interface.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Diogo Nunes

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ColoredPrinter.Builder
      Builder pattern: allows the caller to specify the attributes that it wants to change and keep the default values in the others.

      • close

        public void close()
        This method is called through the java.lang.AutoCloseable interface. It is called when the garbage collector of the JVM determines that this object no longer has any references being made to it. It is usually used for streams that must be closed in order to assure that the data has made it's way through the stream.

        Do not call this method.

        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
